messages.message: @Kerry @Balaram @poc people note that there will be some upcoming changes to the Provenance tracking API - these may be breaking changes if you have written UDFs that make direct calls to the Tracker object’s track() functions. (i.e. track1D, etc…)
@Kerry do you use any UDFs that do this?
Will this affect any of the solutions on the marketplace?

Hey - so @nakul none of the solutions I have in Marketplace or any US Markets production flow currently have provenance tracking turned on, so nothing will break. @Aaron Vontell I did use a lot of track functions in some old UDFs I wrote. I think this is a good time for people who do lots of customer work (like the POC team, solution team, @Balaram, and myself) to re-learn provenance tracking the right way. Maybe you can schedule a meeting (lunch and learn?) to give us a tutorial.
@Aaron Vontell We are not using provenance tracking for the active POCs. Agree with Kerry it will be great if we can have a session
